      • getEndDate

        public static java.lang.String getEndDate(java.lang.String startDate,
                                          java.lang.String format,
                                          double minutes)
                                   throws java.text.ParseException
        Returns the result date after adding or subtracting the times in minute
        Parameters:
        startDate - date which user selected
        format - format of the date the user selected
        minutes - the number of minutes to add to given startDate
        Returns:
        end date after adding required number of minutes to startDate
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the start date is not in the given date format

      • stringDateConversion

        public static java.lang.String stringDateConversion(java.lang.String inputFormat,
                                                    java.lang.String outputFormat,
                                                    java.lang.String input)
                                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                    java.text.ParseException
        Returns the formatted date in String based on the given format
        Parameters:
        inputFormat - date format of input string
        outputFormat - date format of output string intended
        input - date to be formatted
        Returns:
        string of the input date with intended format
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is not date
        java.text.ParseException - if input string is not in the given input format

      • stringToSqlDateConversion

        public static java.sql.Timestamp stringToSqlDateConversion(java.lang.String inputFormat,
                                                           java.lang.String input)
                                                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                           java.text.ParseException
        Returns the formatted date to SQL timestamp based on the given format
        Parameters:
        inputFormat - date format of input string
        input - Date to b formatted
        Returns:
        date object in sql timestamp format of the input date with intended format
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input string is not date
        java.text.ParseException - if input string is not in the given input format

      • getTimeDistanceSecond

        public static int getTimeDistanceSecond(java.lang.String startDate,
                                        java.lang.String endDate)
                                 throws java.text.ParseException
        Returns the times difference in second for two different dates. Order of input does not matter. i.e. getTimeDistanceSecond(date1, date2) returns the same output as getTimeDistanceSecond(date2, date1)
        Parameters:
        startDate - first date
        endDate - second date
        Returns:
        the distance between two date in second
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the given date is not in the date format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"

      • isAfter

        public static boolean isAfter(java.lang.String startDate,
                              java.lang.String endDate)
                       throws java.text.ParseException
        To check if a date is before or after another date.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the start date time stamp
        endDate - the end date time stamp
        Returns:
        true if endDate is after startDate
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException - if the given date is not in the date format "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
